result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jarrel Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution.   
- As to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: *12/15/2020  Honorable Frederick C. Rosa signed ORDER:  the judgments of convictions in 15CF000478, 16CF003314, 16CF003697 and 17CF000622 shall be amended  to clarify that the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving a combined eight years of initial confinement.*
CONSECUTIVE TO ANY EXISTING SENTENCE, with credit for 294 days time served.
- The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" AFTER SERVING 8 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm body armor or ammunition.  
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Copy of order mailed to defendant.  rmm
ORDER AMENDING JUDGMENTS OF CONVICTION, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
AS TO 15CF478, 16CF3314, 16CF3697, 17CF622: Defendant Michael Jarrel Miller in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Michael Jarrel Miller in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO 15CF478:
COUNT 1- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO ANY EXISTING SENTENCE), with credit for 294 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

AS TO 16CF3314:
COUNT 1- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO ANY EXISTING SENTENCE); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 
COUNT 2- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONCURRENT); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 

AS TO 16CF3697:
COUNT 4- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONCURRENT TO ANY EXISTING SENTENCE); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision:   
*No CONTACT with victim, Claude H.  
Court orders restitution in the amount of $1938.38 awarded to Claude H. joint and several with co-actor, Marquell Baker.

AS TO 17CF622: 
COUNT 1- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 
COUNT 2- The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 1 AND 3); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 
COUNT 3-  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" AFTER SERVING 8 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution.   
As to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm body armor or ammunition.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Michael Jarrel Miller not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared (by phone) for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference held.  ADA Daugherty is currently in trial and unable to appear in person.  Defense counsel requests firm sentencing date.  Court orders matter adjourned for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant appears by Attorney Joel Mogren (by phone).  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Patricia Daugherty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has 15CF478,16CF3314, 16CF3697 and 17CF622 scheduled for sentencing this afternoon.  Court conducts conference with counsel.  Defense is requesting adjourned date.  State does not object.  Court grants adjournment.  Court orders all matter set for status conference.  New sentencing date to be selected on next date.  Status conference scheduled on 10/5/17 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Attorney Joel Mogren court, defendant Michael Miller not in court, in custody.  Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in Court for sentencing hearing as to 15CF478, 16CF3697, 17CF622 and 16CF3314.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing, Court orders sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled on 9/15/17 at 1:30pm in Br. 35.

Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE PENDING SENTENCING HEARING. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but with held pending restitution and recompense.

Court will not take any action at this time.

Defendant Michael Jarrel Miller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.  Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.   

AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-18-2016 at 8:30, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial on 01-25-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 01-07-2016 received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Michael Jarrel Miller in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Off the record discussion. Case remains in motion hearing posture. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. 

Sworn for the state:  Christopher Navarrette, Officer- Milwaukee Police Department,  Exhibit  1, 2, and 4 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.   Sworn for defense: Christopher Conway, Officer- Milwaukee Police Department. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to testify. Defense rests.  State and defense rest. Closing arguments heard. Findings of fact. Legal analysis. Court DENIED defense motion to suppress evidence. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies given to state and defense counsel. 

State to provide reports/summary of expert witness no later than 10-26-2015 by 5:00 pm. Any motion challenging the admissibility of proposed expert testimony due no later than 11-16-2015 by 5:00 pm. Response due no later than 11-30-2015 by 5:00 pm.

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 01-08-2016 at 8:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 01-25-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
